## repeat() function

Iterator yielding an infinite (by default) repetition of given value `x`<!-- -->. If `n` is given, only produces that many values.

See also: [repeatedly()](./transducers.repeatedly.md)

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function repeat<T>(x: T, n?: number): Generator<T, void, unknown>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  x | <code>T</code> | value to repeat |
|  n | <code>number</code> | num values (default: âˆž) |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Generator<T, void, unknown>`

## Example


```ts
[...repeat(42, 5)]
// [42, 42, 42, 42, 42]

```
